description: This file implements the creation and removal functions for a cryptographic object within a system that uses OpenSSL (SSLeay). It defines functions to create (`AnscCryptoPubSSLeayCreate`) and delete (`AnscCryptoPubSSLeayRemove`) instances of a crypto object, initialize its method pointers, and manages internal memory allocation. The file is part of a larger cryptographic library related to certificate and key management, with specific focus on RSA, DSA, and Diffie-Hellman operations.

methods.name: ANSC_HANDLE AnscCryptoPubSSLeayCreate(ANSC_HANDLE hOwnerContext)
methods.description: Constructs and initializes a new cryptographic object, setting function pointers for cryptographic operations like RSA, DSA, and Diffie-Hellman.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS AnscCryptoPubSSLeayRemove(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Deletes a cryptographic object and frees associated memory.
